headline: Miso Soup with Shiitake Mushrooms
description: This delicious Japanese soup features with Shiitake mushrooms and tofu.
name: Miso Soup with Shiitake Mushrooms
recipeIngredient: 2 green onions, trimmed and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the vegetable broth to a boil in a saucepan. Add the mushrooms, reduce heat to low, and simmer 4 minutes. Stir the miso paste and soy sauce together in a small bowl; add to the broth along with the tofu and continue cooking for 1 minute more. Pour the soup into bowls and top with the green onions to serve.

review.reviewBody: Amazing Recipe! Makes enough for even the hungriest of people!
Very versatile recipe! It as very good as written. My second try I used enoki mushrooms, thin sliced radish and rice noodles. Still a five star!
First time ever using miso,I truly dig this soup

The taste was awesome, but the presentation of the soup could use some work. I admittedly messed up on the order of the ingredients (added miso paste and soy sauce before chicken broth boiled) and then added the shiitake mushrooms and it didn’t come out nearly as creamy or cloudy looking as the pictures. It took on a more brown hue that wasn’t quite as appetizing looking. I might try white Cremini mushrooms next time and follow the recipe more closely

This was delicious, but perhaps because of the miso I used, I had to add 1.5 cups of water to the 2 serving portion I made because it was too salty. I might try adding seaweed, daikon, enoki, and other ingredients next time to make it a little more interesting.
Added wakame seaweed, turned out great.

Came up with this recipe for my brother´s birthday and everyone was amazed! thank you so much. I bought the Shiitakes online and the quality was amazing. Although, I'll be needing more shiitakes recipes because I bought the big jar! help !
Simply delicious , and healthy. I followed the instructions and added Bak Choy . Yum ! Highly recommend
Great recipe. I made it once with the soy sauce, but it was too salty. I left it out the second and the family loved it. I also added pieces of seaweed with the green onions.
it was SO good, salty, warm, comforting. Family and friends liked it
Easy to make and tastes authentic.

I made the soup as written. I'm no expert on Miso soup, but I thought the taste was very good. I actually made it for my daughter, the vegetarian. She said it was a keeper but to put less soy sauce in it next time.
I really like this recipe, quick, easy and delicious. I am not a big fan of dashi stock so I really like that it uses veg stock for this recipe.

So good and so quick! I've made it twice so far. The first time, I accidentally put way too much soya sauce so it was good but a little too salty. I also didn't have Miso paste. The second time though, I had Miso paste and I didn't overdo the soya sauce. It was DELICIOUS! I made several additions to the recipe though. I don't like tofu so I replaced it with thin pieces of beef. I also added udon and every vegetable I could find in my fridge/freezer. What a hearty, healthy and tasty soup it made! Definitely a meal on it's own if you make it the way I did. Even with all that, it didn't take me more than about 25-30 min to make (including boiling/simmering time). I highly recommend this for people with little time on their hands. I doubled the recipe and froze half for days where there's just no time to cook.

I have just recently started trying to cook healthy. This was easy and delicious! I could not find miso paste but I did find a dry miso powder mix and my grocery store. It still came out really good! I accidentally made the mistake of buying soft tofu which i regret. So buy the firm tofu!

For my first miso soup attempt, I liked this recipe. It was easy, quick, and fun to try something new. I did add sea weed. The soup was salty, which is normal for miso, but I think next time I'll at least use low-sodium soy sauce and less BTB veggie base for the same amount of water (I just used as recommended on the jar).

It's a great miso base recipe! You can customized this soup to your liking..I've been looking for a good miso broth and this one is perfect! I added veggies to mine. I used bokchoy, watercress, potato, 3 types of mushrooms (I love it in my soup) enoki,portabello and white and I used udon noodles! Season to your liking, if it needs more salt, then do so! Topped it with green onions then served piping hot!
Easy and quick to cook, taste very delicious.

We used vegetable boullion instead of broth and that made it come out much too salty. The recipe should specify unsalted broth. Otherwise, I was happy to see a miso recipe without the dashi granuals, because I couldn't find those, and I've been wanting to make miso soup. I'll try it again.

Pretty good for being so simple and you have to reeaally love cooked mushrooms (which I do). No wow factor but light and comforting at the same time.
I added a little wakame and served it with a wedge salad with carrots and pea shoot and ginger dressing. I feel megahealthy!
I replaced the Shitake mushrooms with Chantrelle mushrooms and then poured it over a well cooked yam in my soup bowl. It was wonderful but I think pumpkin or another squash would work just as well.
8 cups water, 4 t. BTB veggie base, 10 re- hydrated shitake (add mushroom water to broth), 1/3 cup miso paste, 4 t. soy, 6 green onions, 2/3 of a block of tofu.

I am not familiar with Japanese cuisine, so I can say nothing about the authencity of this soup. Overall, we liked the taste, but we didn`t enjoyed it so much. Maybe the main reason for it is that we didn`t like the taste of the miso paste so much. I think the soup was lacking something, but I don`t know what I want to see here at this point. I added more shiitake mushrooms than the recipe calls for.
Just Delicious! Easy to make and tastes GREAT!
GREAT and easy recipe for my first time making miso soup. Tastes much like the soup at our favorite Japanese restaurant. Thanks for sharing it!
This was quick and easy. I add some seaweed instead of tofu and worked like a charm. Will definitely make this again.
This was delicious, quick, and healthy. I made it as written except that I added a bit of dried wakame (seaweed) after the mushrooms. Used half a "brick" of tofu.
My husband and son both have a fish allergy so this is a great alternative to using dashi stock. We love it!
